<JD_START>
Job Title: Accounting and Financial System Analyst

Location: Charlotte, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Requisition ID: 188419

Posting Locations: Charlotte

Click here to view a Day in the Life of our Teammates!

Our Secret Ingredient is our Teammates. 

We offer great rewards , competitive pay , career advancement and growth opportunities .

Full Time Teammates are also eligible for:

 Paid Training  Paid Time Off plus paid holidays  401(k) with Company matching on a dollar-for-dollar basis  Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)  Group Health Insurance – Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability  Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance 


Refresh and Grow your Career with Us!

Job Overview

The Accounting and Financial Systems Analyst position assists the Accounting and Financial Systems team with accounting process improvements and SAP financial system projects. This position will assist with all accounting processes, financial master data, month-end processing, and financial reporting. The position will also develop skills to serve as the internal expert on all general ledger postings, business processes, and transactions within SAP.

Duties & Responsibilities

 Assist with routine financial accounting processes such as master data creation and maintenance, journal entries, account analysis, and balance sheet reconciliations Assist with SOX testing and other department routines and projects as needed Compile and create Accounting and Financial reports and/or maintain existing reports to support business needs Assists management on project work, process development, and process improvement opportunities Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial statements (balance sheet, profit and loss, and other statements) by collecting, and reviewing business performance and financial information; summarizing financial status Serve as a liaison for special projects outside of Finance in coordination with other functions across the organization. Performs other duties as assigned


Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

 3-5 years of experience with SAP or other ERP systems Expert in MS Excel Accounting knowledge and experience with balance sheet reconciliation, month-end close, and reporting process Strong technical aptitude with problem-solving and root-cause analysis skills Excellent communication, planning, and organization skills Possess a high degree of self-motivation and initiative


Minimum Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree (4 years) Knowledge acquired through 3 to up to 5 years of work experience


Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Financial Information Systems


Work Environment

Office Environment

Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
